title: Aleksandar Langović
text:
Aleksandar Langović (; born February 19, 2001) is a Serbian professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player for <a href="KK%20Podgorica">Podgorica</a> of the <a href="Prva%20A%20Liga">Prva A Liga</a> and the <a href="ABA%20League%20Second%20Division">ABA League Second Division</a>.
Early career.
Langović joined the youth teams of <a href="KK%20Mega%20Basket">Mega Basket</a> in 2015. In August 2018, he participated at the <a href="Basketball%20Without%20Borders">Basketball Without Borders</a> Europe camp in <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>, Serbia. Langović was selected to the all-tournament team for the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Euroleague%20Basketball%20Next%20Generation%20Tournament">2018–19 season</a> of the <a href="Euroleague%20Basketball%20Next%20Generation%20Tournament">Next Generation Tournament</a>. He played a key role in Mega reaching the championship game with 12.0 points, 5.3 rebounds and 2.3 assists per game.
Professional career.
Prior to the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20ABA%20League%20First%20Division">2018–19 ABA League First Division</a> season, Langović was promoted to the <a href="KK%20Mega%20Basket">Mega Bemax</a> first team. Also, he was added to <a href="OKK%20Beograd">OKK Beograd</a> team for the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Basketball%20League%20of%20Serbia">2018–19 Basketball League of Serbia</a> season as a two-way affiliate player. On April 18, 2018, he made his OKK Beograd debut and the first career start in a road win against <a href="KK%20Dunav%20Stari%20Banovci">Dunav</a> with 9 points, 6 rebounds, and 1 assist.
On 18 June 2021, Langović was loaned out to <a href="KK%20Podgorica">Podgorica</a>.
National team career.
Langović was a member of the <a href="Serbia%20men%27s%20national%20under-16%20basketball%20team">Serbian under-16 team</a> that won the bronze medal at the <a href="2017%20FIBA%20Europe%20Under-16%20Championship">2017 FIBA Europe Under-16 Championship</a> in <a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a>. Over seven tournament games, he averaged 10.3 points, 6.4 rebounds and 0.4 assists per game. He was a member of the <a href="Serbia%20men%27s%20national%20under-17%20basketball%20team">Serbian under-17 team</a> that participated at the <a href="2018%20FIBA%20Under-17%20Basketball%20World%20Cup">2018 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup</a> in <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>. Over seven tournament games, he averaged 9.1 points, 7.0 rebounds and 0.6 assists per game.
